title: Initialization
description:
I first got into programming with Visual Basic by following resources I could find online in my free time.

Shortly after, I learned LOGO which was the first programming language I got a proper and in-depth understanding of.

This early start helped me develop good foundation for other programming languages down the line.

title: Mining and Crafting
description:
I started writing mods for Minecraft in Java.

Mod development helped me with learning about VCS and conventions.

Quick iteration over different setups and no requirement for finishing projects gave an opportunity to learn good project management.

title: Scaling to Kotlin
description:
As I found abstraction very useful, I went on to learn Scala because I was missing it's trait system while developing in Java.

I finally landed on Kotlin as my go to language for JVM because it cleaned up a lot of legacy in Java that were left from it's evolution over the years.

title: Assemble All the Things
description:
During my high school education I learned some fundamentals of asassembly, C and C++.

At this point I had a basic understanding of how code works at a lower level. Around this time I also started toying with Linux and FOSS.

title: Android's Jamming
description:
I started developing an Android application as my high school final project.

It was a music player inspired by Spotify, that allowed streaming music from YouTube and local storage in background.

title: Going Learning
description: I fiddled around with programming language Go and wrote a few small CLI tools.

title: Reacting to Complexity
description: As I didn't like repeating same HTML snippets all over the place and found bare-bones HTML, CSS and JS development quite tedius, I started using React through the recommendation of a university colleague.

title: Vue the Simple
description:
I started using Vue as I found it to be much simpler and less opinionated than React.

I wrote a previous version of my portfolio in it.

title: Full-on Compile Mode
description:
During the summer break after the end of the first year of my university education I started using C++ as my go to language.

Throughout the break I watched a lot of C++ weekly by Jason Turner.

Through his videos I found out about Godbolt, and started thinking about performance while writing code.

I also developed a sweet tooth for template metaprogramming.

title: Slow Oxydation
description:
At the end of 2020 I started developing mostly in Rust. I had tried it before, but never quite grasped it until then.

Macros replaced most of my need for abstraction and metaprogramming, and I had never felt as happy with a programming language as I do with Rust.

title: SEO with Svelte
description:
I wanted to rewrite my web portfolio as I thought the previous one looked terrible and due to serverless hosting SEO with Vue would never give me the results I wanted.

I ended up looking for ideal technology stack to use and as version 3 of Nuxt.js wasn't available, I ended up giving a shot to Svelte.

I like it the most so far, and SvelteKit does everything I need out of the box with very few transitive dependencies.
